thread.title: Aung San Suu Kyi WILL be stripped of Newcastle Freedom of City honour

author: Jonathon Manning
title: Aung San Suu Kyi WILL be stripped of Newcastle Freedom of City honour
text:

Nobel Peace Prize winner Aung San Suu Kyi will be stripped of the Freedom of Newcastle after councillors from across party lines banded together to take back the honour. 
Newcastle City Council originally awarded Ms Suu Kyi Freedom of the City in 2011 “in recognition of her long-standing campaign in support of human rights and freedom of speech”. 
But the Myanmar State Counsellor will now be stripped of the honour for failing to condemn the persecution of the Rohingya people in her home country. Aung San Suu Kyi (Image: AP) 
Over 650,000 Rohingya people have been forced to flee their homes because of a military crackdown in Myanmar, and many are now living in camps in Bangladesh. 
The United Nations has said the treatment of the Rohingya people “cannot be ruled out as genocide”. 
At a meeting on Wednesday night, members of the Newcastle Bangladesh community filled the Civic Centre’s public gallery to hear the result of a motion was put forward by council leader Nick Forbes . 
In his opening speech, Coun Forbes said: “This is a chance to show we are serious that Newcastle is a freedom city. 
“We can’t all fail but to be moved by the plight of those driven out of their homes, out of their country, and who have seen their homes and villages burnt behind them.” Nick Forbes leader of Newcastle City Council (Image: Newcastle Chronicle) 
The motion was seconded by Coun Dipu Ahad, who said the council did not want to remove Ms Suu Kyi’s honour but needed to in order to show it would not stand by silently. 
Conservative and Liberal Democrat councillors also added their support to the proposal, which was unanimously agreed. 
Freedom of the City is an honorary title and the highest accolade the council is able to bestow. It has previously been given to humanitarians including Nelson Mandela , Bob Geldof and Andrei Sakharov. 
The award has never before been revoked, meaning the Constitutional Committee now needs to establish the arrangements needed to withdraw Freedom of the City from Ms Suu Kyi. Read More 
When the motion was passed, Coun Forbes said: “Normally when we consider the Freedom of the City we do so with joy and with a sense of pride. Now there is no sense of pride or joy. 
“We are united by our condemnation and our sorrow that this has come to pass. 
“This doesn’t feel remote or distant. This is a part of the world where we have many people from living in this city, who have done so much to raise money to help there fellow Muslims in their time of need. “This is about us standing should to shoulder with the affected community. What we are doing tonight is showing we stand in solidarity with those affected and that we uphold our values by guarding them. 
“People will say this city, its council, and its communities are united in their condemnation, and are part of a movement to bring about change.” Like us on Facebook
